question: 洞穴
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading of <ja>洞</ja> is one you've learned. The reading of <ja>穴</ja> isn't one you've learned, though. So, think about how you go inside this <vocabulary>cave</vocabulary>, only to find yourself covered by some red goopy liquid. You think it's blood, but luckily it just turns out to be <reading>ketsu</reading>p (<ja>けつ</ja>). If you want to be less formal, you can also use the kun'yomi and say <ja>ほらあな</ja>, but then you'd never learn that reading for <ja>穴</ja>, and where's the fun in that?
